title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale about the dangers of totalitarianism.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel that explores themes of decadence, idealism, resistance to change, social upheaval, and excess.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A story about adolescent alienation and loss of innocence in the protagonist Holden Caulfield.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic fantasy novel that follows the quest to destroy the One Ring.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel that charts the emotional development of the protagonist Elizabeth Bennet.

title: The Chronicles of Narnia
author: C.S. Lewis
description: A series of seven fantasy novels that are considered classics of children's literature.

title: Animal Farm
author: George Orwell
description: An allegorical novella that reflects events leading up to the Russian Revolution of 1917 and then on into the Stalinist era of the Soviet Union.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: A novel that follows the experiences of its eponymous heroine, including her growth to adulthood and her love for Mr. Rochester.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian social science fiction novel set in a futuristic World State.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: A novel that explores the passionate and tragic love between Catherine Earnshaw and Heathcliff.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy novel that follows the quest of home-loving hobbit Bilbo Baggins to win a share of the treasure guarded by Smaug the dragon.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: A novel about the voyage of the whaling ship Pequod and its captain, Ahab, who is intent on chasing the giant white whale Moby Dick.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A novel that chronicles the history of the French invasion of Russia and the impact of the Napoleonic era on Tsarist society.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A novel that focuses on the mental anguish and moral dilemmas of Rodion Raskolnikov, an impoverished ex-student in Saint Petersburg who formulates a plan to kill an unscrupulous pawnbroker.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A philosophical novel set in 19th-century Russia that enters deeply into the ethical debates of God, free will, and morality.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A novel that tells of the doomed love affair between the sensuous and rebellious Anna and the dashing officer, Count Vronsky.

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
author: Mark Twain
description: A novel that is a direct sequel to The Adventures of Tom Sawyer, portraying life along the Mississippi River.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An epic poem that is one of two major ancient Greek epic poems attributed to Homer.

title: Great Expectations
author: Charles Dickens
description: A novel that depicts the growth and personal development of an orphan named Pip.

title: Little Women
author: Louisa May Alcott
description: A novel that follows the lives of the four March sisters—Meg, Jo, Beth, and Amy—and details their passage from childhood to womanhood.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
description: A dystopian novel that presents a future American society where books are outlawed and firemen burn any that are found.

title: Don Quixote
author: Miguel de Cervantes
description: A novel that follows the adventures of a noble named Alonso Quixano who reads so many chivalric romances that he decides to become a knight-errant.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A novel about a handsome young man who wishes that his portrait would age instead of him.

title: A Tale of Two Cities
author: Charles Dickens
description: A novel set in London and Paris before and during the French Revolution.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
description: A novel that examines the nature of law and grace, and expounds upon the history of France, the architecture and urban design of Paris, politics, moral philosophy, anti-monarchism, justice, religion, and the types and nature of romantic and familial love.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: A Gothic horror novel about the vampire Count Dracula's attempt to move from Transylvania to England so he may find new blood and spread the undead curse.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A novel about Victor Frankenstein, a young scientist who creates a grotesque creature in an unorthodox scientific experiment.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: A novel about the voyage of the whaling ship Pequod, led by Captain Ahab who is obsessed with the giant white whale Moby Dick.

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
author: Alexandre Dumas
description: An adventure novel that takes place in France, Italy, and islands in the Mediterranean during the historical events of 1815–1838.
